name: snatch22
text: So surreal.  So delightful.

name: luckypyjamas
text: magical surrealism

name: lawbot
text:
YES

YOU ARE CORRECT

name: lordpretzel
text: I was wrong.

name: typo
text: A comment left by typo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sevenarts, onegoodmonkey, Connellingus, MrPoopytime)

name: soticoto
text: Figures Butters would automatically jump in with the Hanna Barbera reference.

name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, Lolsworth, greatwhitehope7, riotdejaneiro, cryztal, Thorfinn, katal, wittyname, dennycrane, GhostD, Moraiat, Sargasm, atticusonline, mikerotch6, michellemarie, mustconcentrate, Rincewind, mira, Jesus, luckypyjamas, aHatOfPig, chatterjee, orrrderup, nutmeg, Cicadalek, Epicurus, prowle4763, scraggg, dropkickpikachu, stormagnet, LiquidCruelty, Rakadin, SPECTRE, Ubermensch)

name: gormster
text: Asherdan, even when you're being nice you're a dick.

name: catachresis
text: The soundtrack to this arc is Black Mirror

name: phy
text: I was thinking more along the lines of incidental music from the '67 Spider-man cartoon.

name: i_love_kate
text: I knew the video to that song reminded me of something.

name: wehavemagnums
text: I guess I'm the only person who finds this FUCKING CREEPY. Love it though.

name: hollis
text: No, I find it really creepy too.  And for some reason the next couple (where the drawings go all fuzzy) disturb me immensely.

name: kazad
text: Dang, the fact that Onstad was able to work a Hanna-Barbera reference into Butters' dialogue there is heroic.

name: soticoto
text:
Into the dialogue?
Dude... that helicopter is powered Flintstones style... That isn't just dialogue; that is the real deal!

name: patkun
text: I'll assume this is a reference to a previous occasion where Ray has attempted to kick a hole in one or more of Bensinton's cars, all the while crying: "I'm Flintstonin' it! Can't you see? "

name: cdl146
text: Here is where the storyline takes a turn for the extremely bizzare.

name: honesttom
text: I love the sign above the ignition. "BEGIN". Generally this entire strip is deeply disturbing.

name: crinklebat
text: I kind of feel like Danny Elfman could write the soundtrack of this strip...but there's about a 50% chance that it would suck balls.

name: shutup_shutup
text: I sort of felt Angelo Badelamenti was more likely.

name: andrewthepig
text: I think Badelamenti is better suited for the Cartilage Head and Ray in hell arcs.

name: mashisoyo
text: Or Neil Young on a theremin.

name: clever-nickname
text: the catleg-copter reminds me of Salvador Dali's drawings.

name: cailetshadow
text: It reminded me of those crazy long-legged horse things from the Dark Crystal. You can totally see the stiff, awkward slow-motion gallop happening in the last two panels.

name: onepapertiger
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: cpnglxynchos
text: those are way creepier than what happens in this arc.

name: atticusonline
text: Sweet! A Keychain!

name: aamzed
text: War of the worlds!

name: quantumcasaba
text: This is what I thought as well.

name: spectre
text: Baba Yaga's house

name: bourbonsamurai
text: My favorite part of this is Ray's "I will listen to music with you for ten minutes Butters."

name: tekende
text: Unfortunately, the copter's radio only picks up one station, which continuously plays "Land of Confusion" by Genesis.

name: ttagxamm
text: Panel Four: The helicopter blinks!

name: tehloki
text: With its eyes in the shape of todd's van

name: scorpio_nadir
text: It is wearing a Mexican wrestler mask. Those fools!

name: samodrei
text: it must be Hecho en Mexico

name: jandruff
text: Their little cat feet go "pouf"

name: scorpio_nadir
text: ....in the night.

name: epicurus
text: How in the fuck is this CHEAPER than a real helicopter?

name: andrewofdoom
text: Ray knows exactly how much time he wants to spend listening to music with Butters.

name: metatronatra
text: The heelacopter looks like a Luchador

name: singtralala
text: wow, how's it possible i totally forgot this whole story?

name: shutup_shutup
text: Maybe you fell asleep?

name: juanclaudius
text:
Alright, I've made a decision. I am gettin a tattoo of the helicopter as it appears in panel 8. Right bicep. It is perhaps my favorite image in all of Achewood for reasons other than humor...and honestly, I can't see a more fitting image to get implanted on me. I'll post pictures on this strip when it's done, and send some to Chris (perhaps he'll put them up somewhere...)
Just wanted to give y'alls a heads-up.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: tat pic or GTFO

name: juanclaudius
text: I actually spent a long amount of time informing people of this decision, and the general consensus was to ask numerous probing questions for way too long about the overall purpose of such a tattoo. Instead, tonight at the free tattoo/signing deal in portland, i got young Beef listening to a cassette tape looking dismayed, and the cassette tape is saying "you can do whatever you want in life." this is an easily explained tattoo.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
what i want to know is if they have the key, why can't they fly it?

alternatively: shouldn't the pilot have the key..?

name: arelladawn
text: THIS is the best story arc ever

name: duperando
text: effing hilarious. like... it blows my mind how much this tickles me.
